@graph.title: Corporate governance in Turkey : a pilot study
abstract: It is widely expected that there will be rapid growth in Turkey in the coming decade.&nbsp; This will fuel companies' demand for external finance to expand their businesses or establish new ones. To attract such finance on competitive terms, domestic equity markets need to expand and foreign investment needs to increase. This will happen only if corporate governance standards are high, meaning both a well-established and cost-effective legal and regulatory framework and company practices that favour transparency and the protection of minority shareholders. It is widely expected that there will be rapid growth in Turkey in the coming decade. This will fuel companies' demand for external finance to expand their businesses or establish new ones. To attract such finance on competitive terms, domestic equity markets need to expand and foreign investment needs to increase. This will happen only if corporate governance standards are high, meaning both a well-established and cost-effective legal and regulatory framework and company practices that favour transparency and the protection of minority shareholders.This report evaluates the extent to which the OECD Principles of Corporate Governance have been implemented in Turkey, looking at both the legal and regulatory framework as well as company practices.
